intro: Cerbera manghas var. mugfordii, commonly known as the Mugford's manghass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically orange or red in color. It has smooth, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
